title: Boro Hotel is a MUST for NYC travelers! - Review
text:
You pull up to this monolith of a cool, industrial, dark building, and are wowed by its presence. The Wows continue. Decor is simple industrial Chic and the comfort of being in a serene pastel walled room with cement creeping out on all ends plus wall of windows facing NYC and seeing the Con Ed Ravenswood station and New York City. Then the bar! The Food! We had a hard time leaving. There was avocado toast, pancakes, egg sandwiches and my favorite Hot Faro with almond milk and greek yogurt. Burgers, sandwiches, and home made potato chips. Then to walk three blocks to the train station and first stop you are in NYC is a treat. This place is a gem 10 minutes from LaGuardia. I fell in love with Queens, as I had time to enjoy it, from the Moving Images Museum to Moma's PS1, and all the restaurants around, we struggled to force ourselves to visit all our New York favorites. This was a dreamy New York week, all due to where we stayed. Love the management team, and Neo at the bar is super cool.
